attributes.action: Do Not Allow A Second Referendum on The UK Leaving The EU
attributes.additional_details:
The Prime Minister David Cameron announced on 20th February 2016 that a referendum would be held on 23rd June 2016 to decide if the UK should leave or remain in the EU.
The whole population of the UK and Northern Ireland had fair warning of the coming referendum, and consequently their right to vote.
The British people voted to leave the EU.
  The vote was fair and legal.
It is unfair and undemocratic for the result of the referendum held on 23rd June 2016 revoked
attributes.background:
The UK held a referendum on 23rd June 2016 to decide whether to leave or remain within the EU
The British people decided to Leave the EU, there can be no second chance to vote on remaining or leaving the EU
